2.text: “Bear with me a little, and I will show you; for I still have something to say on God’s behalf.

3.text: I will get my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

4.text: For truly my words are not false. One who is perfect in knowledge is with you.

5.text: “Behold, God is mighty, and doesn’t despise anyone. He is mighty in strength of understanding.

6.text: He doesn’t preserve the life of the wicked, but gives to the afflicted their right.

7.text: He doesn’t withdraw his eyes from the righteous, but with kings on the throne, he sets them forever, and they are exalted.

8.text: If they are bound in fetters, and are taken in the cords of afflictions,

9.text: then he shows them their work, and their transgressions, that they have behaved themselves proudly.

10.text: He also opens their ears to instruction, and commands that they return from iniquity.

11.text: If they listen and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

12.text: But if they don’t listen, they shall perish by the sword; they shall die without knowledge.

13.text: “But those who are godless in heart lay up anger. They don’t cry for help when he binds them.

14.text: They die in youth. Their life perishes among the unclean.

15.text: He delivers the afflicted by their affliction, and opens their ear in oppression.

16.text: Yes, he would have allured you out of distress, into a broad place, where there is no restriction. That which is set on your table would be full of fatness.

17.text: “But you are full of the judgment of the wicked. Judgment and justice take hold of you.

18.text: Don’t let riches entice you to wrath, neither let the great size of a bribe turn you aside.

19.text: Would your wealth sustain you in distress, or all the might of your strength?

20.text: Don’t desire the night, when people are cut off in their place.

21.text: Take heed, don’t regard iniquity; for you have chosen this rather than affliction.

22.text: Behold, God is exalted in his power. Who is a teacher like him?

23.text: Who has prescribed his way for him? Or who can say, ‘You have committed unrighteousness?’

24.text: “Remember that you magnify his work, whereof men have sung.

25.text: All men have looked thereon. Man sees it afar off.

26.text: Behold, God is great, and we don’t know him. The number of his years is unsearchable.

27.text: For he draws up the drops of water, which distill in rain from his vapor,

28.text: Which the skies pour down and which drop on man abundantly.

29.text: Yes, can any understand the spreading of the clouds, and the thunderings of his pavilion?

30.text: Behold, he spreads his light around him. He covers the bottom of the sea.

31.text: For by these he judges the people. He gives food in abundance.

32.text: He covers his hands with the lightning, and commands it to strike the mark.

33.text: Its noise tells about him, and the livestock also concerning the storm that comes up.
